intro: Deprea hirtiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered deprea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
